Odin-Bot.name: Odin-Bot V2 Unit Tests and Refactor
Odin-Bot.description: I contributed by way of adding unit tests to this open source project used by a Discord server of approximately 30,000. I lead a small team in implementing these tests, and was responsible for writing new documentation so contributors would have a clear and concise contributing guide, even if they themselves were unfamiliar with unit testing. Along the way, we realized that the original code was not easily testable, and I along with my teammates refactored the existing code so future contributors would have a cleaner way of setting up and testing commands.

Task.Me - React.name: Task.Me - React Version
Task.Me - React.description: This is a client-side only version of a task manager that leverages the Local Storage API to save tasks and projects. I used MaterialUI for styling, and mirrored the functionality and look from Asana. A user may choose unique colors to more easily find their projects, and the home screen offers a broad display of their pending projects and upcoming tasks.

The Clubhouse.name: The Clubhouse
The Clubhouse.stack: EJS, MongoDB Atlas, NodeJS, Express, Heroku, TailwindCSS
The Clubhouse.description: A full stack message board project with different levels of account privileges, and different conditional views rendered if a user has certain privileges. The project sanitizes and validates user input with Express Validator, and sends flash messages in the event of an error.

Cherub 214.name: Cherub 214 - Shopify Template
Cherub 214.description: A client project for a New York streetwear designer. This project leveraged Bootstrap 4.5, vanilla Javascript, some JQuery, and Liquid templating. The CSS was organized with BEM. Documentation was also written for the client, and periodic updates to remain consistent with Shopify's platform have been included. Link currently not available, but you may request to see the code so far.

Tender Gear.name: Tender Gear - Shopify Template
Tender Gear.description: A client project for a hockey related merchandise vendor. This project leveraged mostly plain CSS with Sass, vanilla Javascript, some JQuery, and Liquid templating. Documentation was also written for the client. I periodically provide the client with updated versions as Shopify makes tools such as Sass deprecated on their platform. Use password: admin to access the store below.

Catalyst Roster Automation.name: Catalyst Roster Automation
Catalyst Roster Automation.description: A Python script that logs in to university staff internal system, navigates browser, downloads files into a named and dated folder. This project was born out of frustration with the University's old .NET website that makes it difficult to download many things at once, and this script takes a job that takes 5 minutes too many of my time, and executes it in a 30 second or so job.

Genneya Walton.name: GenneyaWalton.com
Genneya Walton.description: Website for Netflix breakout star Genneya Walton of #BLACKAF and Project MC2.
